content.key_points:
**Norplant Contraceptive System:**

- **Implantation site**: Norplant capsules are placed under the skin of a woman's upper arm
- **Duration**: Can prevent pregnancy for at least 5 years
- **Effectiveness**: Effective within 24 hours after insertion
- **Side effects**: Can cause changes in menstrual bleeding, and may cause headache, breast tenderness, acne, weight gain, hair loss and more hair growth on the face
- **Insertion technique**: Inserted in the midportion of the upper arm about 8-10 cm above the elbow crease

questions.question_text:
Which of the following body parts is the usual site used for implantation of Norplant?

![Anatomical diagram showing body parts for Norplant implantation](norplant_anatomy_diagram.png)

**Instructions**: Put an X on the areas.
questions.correct_answer: Upper arm (midportion, 8-10 cm above elbow crease)
questions.rationale:
**RATIONALE**

Norplant is inserted in the midportion of the upper arm about 8-10 cm above the elbow crease.

![Norplant insertion site illustration](norplant_insertion_site.png)

**Key Concept**: Norplant capsules are usually placed under the skin of a woman's upper arm.

images.description: Anatomical diagram showing body parts with areas for Norplant implantation site selection
images.context: embedded in question text for site identification exercise

images.description: Illustration showing proper Norplant insertion site on upper arm
images.context: embedded in rationale to demonstrate correct placement location

extraction_metadata.notes: Fill-in-blank/image marking question with anatomical diagrams in both question and rationale sections. Content consolidated from left page of PDF page 155.
